other_tests.findings: Atrial fibrillation at a ventricular rate of 130 beats per minute, without evidence of ischemic changes.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The ECG later revealed atrial fibrillation at a ventricular rate of 100 beats per minute, without evidence of myocardial infarction.

other_tests.findings: Moderate pleural effusions, a small pericardial effusion, and patchy air-space opacities in the lower lobes, the lingula, and the right upper lobe, suggesting pneumonia and basilar atelectasis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: A repeated thoracic CT scan disclosed the same bilateral pleural effusions, small pericardial effusion, and right-upper-lobe and lingular opacities; the basilar atelectasis was slightly improved.

other_tests.findings: IgM level of 2.2 U (normal level, less than 1) and IgG level of 5.2 U (normal level, less than 1).
other_tests.changes_over_time: Three weeks later, levels showed increased IgM greater than 11.4 U and IgG 15.5 U, indicating recent infection by human granulocytic ehrlichia.

other_tests.findings: Normal rhythm while at rest, with atrial premature beats and nonspecific ST-segment and T-wave abnormalities.
other_tests.changes_over_time: At a deliberately submaximal work load, no evidence of ischemia or infarction was seen.
